decks.notes: This Legacy Goblins deck focuses on quickly ramping out powerful creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster, Legion Warboss, and Muxus, Goblin Grandee using mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Gemstone Caverns. The deck also includes disruption elements like Chalice of the Void to control the game and protect your creatures. With a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early in the game and maintain pressure to secure a quick victory.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy using control spells like Daze and Force of Will while also being aggressive with creatures like Murktide Regent and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm. Reanimate allows for graveyard interaction and Hymn to Tourach helps with hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board state with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict and gain card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed for consistency and disruption with Wasteland and fetch lands.

The deck focuses on utilizing the "Painter's Servant" and "Grindstone" combo to mill opponents' entire deck in one turn. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur combo pieces, as well as disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. It uses mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Mox Opal to quickly set up the combo. With efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble and execute its win condition.

The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Murktide Regent to close out games quickly. Wasteland and other land disruption help to keep opponents off balance. The deck is aggressive and proactive, looking to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game.

This deck relies on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly establish board presence and control the tempo of the game. By utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria, Chalice of the Void, and Solitude, it aims to limit the opponent's options while deploying its own threats efficiently. The inclusion of cards like City of Traitors and Chrome Mox enable explosive starts, while cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer provide card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its proactive strategy and capitalize on early advantages to secure victory.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro Legacy deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Opposition Agent, while aggressively attacking with efficient creatures like Grief and Stalactite Stalker. The deck also utilizes powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate to quickly bring back key threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. By playing disruptive spells and efficient creatures, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using cards like Force of Will, Stifle, and Dress Down to control the opponent's plays while efficiently getting out the powerful Phyrexian Dreadnought. It also includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Daze for card selection and tempo advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently finishing the game with Phyrexian Dreadnought. Additionally, cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Swords to Plowshares provide additional versatility and removal options. The strategy revolves around controlling the game state and outmaneuvering the opponent to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of aggressive goblin creatures, supported by cards that generate additional resources or provide protection. With a mix of low-cost creatures and high-powered finishers like Muxus, Goblin Grandee, the deck aims to deliver rapid and consistent damage to close out the game before the opponent can establish their own strategy. The inclusion of cards like Cavern of Souls and Chalice of the Void further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining its aggressive momentum.

This deck aims to quickly assemble and execute the Doomsday combo by using various tutors and cantrips to find the necessary pieces. The deck packs disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The win condition is typically using Doomsday to stack the library with Thassa's Oracle on top, followed by drawing a card to win the game. The deck is built around efficiency and speed to combo off as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
